Description: Painted wooden shabti of Hunero with black tripartite wig, white painted body, white earrings, yellow face and hands with white eyes and black pupils and cosmetic lines; arms crossed in relief to hold two black painted hoes, red bracelets or three central vertical lines at crossing point of arms; red bordered yellow background vertical line of hieroglyphs in black identifying the deceased as lady of the house.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom
